text: Thayer is a city in Neosho County, Kansas, United States. In 2020 census, 432 people lived there. ==History== Thayer was planned out in the fall of 1870. This is when the railroad was extended to that point. It was named after Nathaniel Thayer, a railroad employee. The town was built up quickly and was incorporated as a city in 1871. ==Geography== Thayer is at (37.487127, -95.476237). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Of that, is land and is water. ===Weather=== Thayer has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Thayer has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Thayer, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 432 people, 191 households, and 131 families living in Thayer. Of the households, 62.8% owned their home and 37.2% rented their home. The median age was 41.5 years. Of the people, 89.1% were White, 0.9% were Native American, 0.5% were from some other race, and 9.5% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 2.8% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 497 people, 197 households, and 136 families living in Thayer. ==Education== Thayer is part of USD 447 Cherryvale. ==Famous people== * Nellie Shepherd, painter ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Thayer - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 447, local school district ;Maps * Thayer City Map , KDOT Category:1870 establishments in Kansas Category:Cities in Kansas
title: Thayer, Kansas
